definition: to play deaf-mute
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack
deaf
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)
(onom.) sound of cawing/sound of infant learning to talk/variant of 呀[ya1]
dumb/mute/hoarse/husky/unexploded (of artillery shell etc)

sentences.english: Some fell on deaf ears-wilfully deaf, in the case of the European left.
sentences.chinese: 有些人確故意裝聾作啞，比如歐洲的左派。

sentences.english: He’d hint at his dissatisfaction, and I’d play dumb.
sentences.chinese: 他會對我暗示自己的不滿，對此我裝聾作啞。

sentences.english: They knew that discrimination was going on, but chose to ignore it.
sentences.chinese: 他們當時知道歧視現象仍然存在，但是寧願裝聾作啞。

sentences.english: In Europe it is apparent that the referees have an ignorance problem.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲賽場上，裁判們似乎都明顯地愛裝聾作啞。

sentences.english: Had he been on deck, he could no longer so much as have pretended not to understand the situation.
sentences.chinese: 要是他留在甲板上，他就無法再裝聾作啞。

sentences.english: Don't play dumb with me. If you think you can fool me, you are sorely mistaken.
sentences.chinese: 別跟我裝聾作啞，如果你以爲能騙我，就大錯特錯了。

definition: lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
overbearing/arrogant bully
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
to exaggerate
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to smash
to imitate the dog and steal chicken (idiom)/to pilfer/to dally with women/to have affairs
accomplice/accessory
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
